div1.p: Truby provides a sketch of the room where Reed died in 1902.

div1.head: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, December 29, 1947
div1.opener:
Albert E. Truby
145 Laurel Street
San Francisco, California
Dec. 29/47
Dear Col. Hench-
div1.p:
Your special delivery of the
27th came Sunday the 28th. Fast!
I will write the C.O. as you suggested.
Here is a rough sketch of the
room as I remember it.

Of course I am guessing about the exact
size of the room, but it is about right
all the 4 walls of the room as outlined
were solid plastered walls.

In photo. no 4 you are pointing to the
temporary wall. The room in 1902
had but one door & one window. It
now has 3 doors.

Re. the photo-stats why not send
those you wont need at once and
those you wish to hold on to, at
a later date? Anyway is O.K. with
me. If the type is not too fine and
indistinct I could do them all in
short order I think.
div1.closer:
With best regards
Sincerely Albert E. Truby Have a good time in Cuba. It is
a paradise at this season.
